Class Student

java.lang.Object
entity.User
entity.Student
public class Student extends User
Represents a student user who can apply for internship positions.

This entity manages student-specific domain logic including eligibility rules, application caps, and placement restrictions. Students are subject to the following domain constraints:

Eligibility Rules:

  • Year 1-2 students: Eligible for BASIC level internships only
  • Year 3-4 students: Eligible for BASIC, INTERMEDIATE, and ADVANCED level internships

Application Limits:

  • Maximum of 3 active applications per student
  • Active applications include PENDING and SUCCESSFUL (but not yet accepted) statuses
  • Exactly one confirmed placement allowed per student

  • Field Details

    • MAX_ACTIVE_APPLICATIONS

      public static final int MAX_ACTIVE_APPLICATIONS
      Maximum number of active applications allowed per student. Active applications are those in PENDING status or SUCCESSFUL but not yet accepted.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Student

      public Student(String userId, String name, String major, int yearOfStudy, String email)
      Creates a new student record.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique user identifier
      name - the student's full name
      major - the student's academic major
      yearOfStudy - the numeric year of study (1-4)
      email - the student's contact email
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any required field is invalid

    • isEligibleFor

      public boolean isEligibleFor(InternshipLevel level)
      Checks if the student is eligible for internships at the given level. Eligibility is based on year of study:
      • Years 1-2: BASIC level only
      • Years 3-4: BASIC, INTERMEDIATE, and ADVANCED levels
      Parameters:
      level - the internship level to check eligibility for
      Returns:
      true if eligible, false otherwise

    • filterEligibleVisibleOpen

      public List<Internship> filterEligibleVisibleOpen(List<Internship> all)
      Filters a list of internships to show only those the student is eligible for, that are currently visible, and open for applications.
      Parameters:
      all - the complete list of internships to filter
      Returns:
      a filtered list containing only eligible, visible, open internships

    • hasConfirmedPlacement

      public boolean hasConfirmedPlacement(Student.AppReadPort apps)
      Checks if the student currently has a confirmed internship placement.
      Parameters:
      apps - the application read port for querying placement status
      Returns:
      true if the student has a confirmed placement, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the apps port is null

    • activeApplicationsCount

      public int activeApplicationsCount(Student.AppReadPort apps)
      Returns the number of active applications counting toward the student's cap. Active applications include PENDING and SUCCESSFUL (but not yet accepted) statuses.
      Parameters:
      apps - the application read port for querying application counts
      Returns:
      the number of active applications
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the apps port is null

    • canStartAnotherApplication

      public boolean canStartAnotherApplication(Student.AppReadPort apps)
      Checks if the student can start another application without exceeding the cap.
      Parameters:
      apps - the application read port for querying application counts
      Returns:
      true if under the application cap, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the apps port is null

    • assertCanApply

      public void assertCanApply(Internship internship, Student.AppReadPort apps)
      Validates that the student can apply for the specified internship. Checks all domain rules including eligibility, application caps, and existing placements.
      Parameters:
      internship - the internship to apply for
      apps - the application read port for validation checks
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if internship or apps port is null
      IllegalStateException - if any domain validation rule is violated

    • assertCanConfirmOffer

      public void assertCanConfirmOffer(Student.AppReadPort apps)
      Validates that the student can confirm an internship offer. Ensures the student doesn't already have a confirmed placement.
      Parameters:
      apps - the application read port for validation checks
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the student already has a confirmed placement
      NullPointerException - if the apps port is null
